title: Meckel's Diverticulum Bleeding
diagnosis_topic: Ectopic gastric mucosa in Meckel's diverticulum causing painless lower GI bleeding
setup_script: A 2-year-old boy presents with passage of bright red stools for one day. He is otherwise active and has no abdominal pain or fever.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 90/55 mmHg, HR 110 bpm, RR 24/min, Temp 37 C.
Maroon and blood-tinged stools with no mucus; digital rectal exam confirms blood without fissures.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders CBC and type and cross
dynamic_flow.reply: Hemoglobin 9 g/dL (low), platelets normal; set up for transfusion if needed.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident obtains technetium-99m pertechnetate (Meckel) scan
dynamic_flow.reply: Uptake in right lower quadrant indicating ectopic gastric mucosa.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident initiates IV fluids and keeps NPO

dynamic_flow.reply: Laparoscopic diverticulectomy performed; bleeding diverticulum excised.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays intervention and bleeding continues
dynamic_flow.reply: Patient may become hemodynamically unstable requiring transfusion.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If Meckel scan is negative but suspicion remains high
dynamic_flow.reply: Consider mesenteric angiography or capsule endoscopy; evaluate for other sources.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses rule of twos
dynamic_flow.reply: Occurs in 2% of population, 2 feet from ileocecal valve, 2 inches long, 2 types of ectopic tissue.
Resume feeding once bowel function returns; monitor for infection or obstruction.
Explain cause, surgical procedure and low risk of recurrence.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for other congenital anomalies
dynamic_flow.reply: Associated with other omphalomesenteric duct remnants or malrotation.

critical_decision_points: Evaluation of painless lower gastrointestinal bleeding in children
Use of Meckel scan to detect ectopic gastric mucosa
Resuscitation and surgical removal of Meckel's diverticulum
Recognition of ongoing bleeding necessitating transfusion and urgent surgery
Postoperative care and rule of twos education
